cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the Byzantine agreement problem in distributed systems, which is a fundamental problem in distributed computing. The use of lattices in the problem suggests that it may fall under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses the use of digital signatures, which is a topic in cryptography and security (cs.CR). The algorithm presented in the paper involves message passing and requires a certain level of fault tolerance, which are topics in distributed systems (cs.DS). The paper also involves information theory, as it discusses the round complexity of the algorithm (cs.IT). Finally, the paper involves machine learning, as it discusses the use of semi-lattices, which are a topic in algebraic structures and may be relevant to machine learning (cs.LG).
